isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Service Manual - Crankcase, Crankshaft, and Camshaft - Removal - Preliminary Checks

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, make sure that the engine has cooled down sufficiently before attempting to remove any components. See "Safety Information."

To avoid serious personal injury or possible death: Do not allow used engine fluids to stay on your skin. Clean your skin and nails with soap and water, or a good hand cleaner. Wash or properly throw away clothing or rags containing used engine fluids. Used engine fluids contain certain elements that may be unhealthy for skin and could even cause cancer. See "Safety Information."

note.para: Engine fluids, oil, fuel and coolant, can be a threat to the environment. Never dispose of engine fluids by putting them in the trash, pouring them on the ground, in the sewers, in streams or bodies of water.
Before removing any of the components in this section, it will be necessary to determine the following backlash and end play checks:

item.para: Primary balancer gear to crankshaft gear

step1.para: Check and record primary balancer gear-to-crankshaft gear backlash as follows:

note.para: Crankshaft gear must be fixed, not allowed to rotate, only the primary balance gear should be allowed to rotate, otherwise the reading will not be valid.

step2.para: Mount Dial Indicator with Magnetic Base onto rear of engine. See Special Service Tools.
Position dial indicator tip onto a primary balancer gear tooth and remove lash.
Zero dial indicator.
Rotate gear by hand and read indicator. Record backlash.
If backlash exceeds specified limits, replace primary balance gear. See Specifications.

step1.para: Check and record camshaft gear-to-crankshaft gear backlash as follows:

note.para: Crankshaft gear must be fixed, not allowed to rotate, only the camshaft gear should be allowed to rotate, otherwise the reading will not be valid.

step2.para: Mount Dial Indicator with Magnetic Base onto rear of engine. See Special Service Tools.
Position dial indicator tip onto a cam gear tooth and remove lash.
Zero dial indicator.
Rotate gear by hand and read indicator. Record backlash.
If backlash exceeds specified limits, replace camshaft gear. See Specifications.

figure.caption: Checking primary balance shaft end play

step1.para: Check and record primary balance shaft end play as follows:

step2.para: Reposition dial indicator tip to balance shaft, not gear.
Push camshaft towards the front of the engine.
Zero dial indicator.
Place a small pry bar between the primary balance gear and crankcase. Lightly pry primary balance gear toward indicator. Compare dial indicator reading with specification. See Specifications.

figure.caption: Removing the balance shaft counterweight bolt

step1.para: Remove the balance shaft counterweight bolt (M10 x 25).

figure.caption: Removing balance shaft thrust plate bolts

step1.para: Remove three balance shaft thrust plate bolts (M6 x 12).

figure.caption: Balance shaft counterweight and thrust plate

step1.para: Remove balance shaft counterweight and thrust plate.
Carefully remove balance shaft from the inside of the camshaft.

note.para: Check end play only after the balance shaft has been removed.

step1.para: Check and record camshaft end play as follows:

step2.para: Reposition dial indicator tip onto camshaft, not gear.
Push camshaft towards the front of the engine.
Zero dial indicator.
Place a small pry bar or screwdriver between the camshaft gear and crankcase. Lightly pry camshaft gear towards indicator. Compare dial indicator measurement with Specifications.

step1.para: Check crankshaft end play as follows:

step2.para: Mount dial indicator on crankcase with indicator tip on the end of crankshaft flange as shown.
Pry crankshaft forward with pry bar and zero dial indicator.
Pry crankshaft back and forth while reading dial indicator. Record end play measurement.
